sentences.en: A visitor to Nebraska today wouldn � � t believe that the state was once a treeless plain.
sentences.cn: 如果你今天去参观内布拉斯加州,你决不会相信那儿曾经是一片光秃秃的大草原.

sentences.en: Below you, though still 50 miles off, is the most treeless stretch of land imaginable.
sentences.cn: 就在你下方，不过是在50英里开外的，是一片你能想象到的最荒凉的不毛之地。

sentences.en: In that treeless waste an object could be seen at half a day's journey distant.
sentences.cn: 在那片寸草不生的荒地上,隔开半天路程的距离,才能看得见一样东西.

sentences.en: The battlefield was so flat and treeless that the troops could not find any cover.
sentences.cn: 战场如此平坦且无树木,以致于军队找不到隐蔽处.

sentences.en: The dry plains of the Sahel are mostly treeless.
sentences.cn: 干燥的荒漠草原几乎寸草不生.

sentences.en: Treeless regions found in and around the Arctic tundra s are among Earth's coldest, harshest biomes.
sentences.cn: 这片光秃秃的地区在北极附近,是地球上最寒冷, 最荒芜的生物群落区之一.

sentences.en: Treeless regions found in and around the Arctic, tundras are among Earth's coldest, harshest biomes.
sentences.cn: 无树地区位于北极圈内及其附近,苔原分布在地球最冷, 最荒芜的生物群落之中.

words.tran_cn: 驱赶…上树；在…上植树；长成树（tree的过去分词）

trans.tran_en: a treeless area has no trees in it
